Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent of the pay decrease by stating that it has been a consistent 8% decrease every year.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough evidence or support to verify the accuracy of the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the pay decrease has been a deliberate action taken by the individual in question, without considering other factors or circumstances.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the reported pay decrease, such as changes in salary structures or budget allocations.
